alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 4:42PM EDT until further notice by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Burlington VT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. For the Lamoille River...including Jeffersonville...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 450.0 feet, Water will rise to near the edge of Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 451.0 feet, Water will cover Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. Traffic diversions may be necessary, and motorists planning to travel route 15 through Cambridge should allow extra time to detour around the flooded roadway. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. At 453.0 feet, Water will begin to enter streets in Jeffersonville. The north end of Main Street will flood first, and low lying homes will be affected. Portions of Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will begin to flood, and there will be widespread field flooding along the river. At 453.5 feet, In Jeffersonville, Main Street, Depot Street, and Maple Street will begin to flood. Businesses along Route 15 in Jeffersonville will flood. Route 15 between Johnson and Fairfax will be inundated and impassable in some areas. There will be widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EDT Monday the stage was 448.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 447.0 feet - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 454.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. High water will close the Wrong Way Bridge in Cambridge early this evening. If planning travel along Route 15 through Cambridge this evening, seek alternate routes. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EDT.
